4.script: Scientific facts that will blow your mind. The longest living cells in the body are nerve cells, they can live up to a lifetime. The average human body carries about 0.2 milligrams of gold. Honey never spoils. William Buckland, a 19th century scientist, thought that evidence of being smart meant having a big chin. Father Magdalon Cake Bake Comerford studied an EDT buried in the Abbey Road Cemetery to find personal anecdotes about 387,193 residents over its thousand-year history of burials, mirific is asked by some the last person to live opposite from the same building that Einstein died.

5.script: "Intriguing scientific facts that will blow your mind. Did you know that a teaspoon of neutron star weighs more than Mt. Everest? Scientists have discovered a new species of shark that can survive up to three months without eating. Plus, want to improve your memory? Chewing gum while studying can actually boost your brainpower. And if you're afraid of spiders, here's a fascinating fact: certain species of spiders have been found to use a form of hydraulic power to launch themselves through the air. Get ready to have your mind expanded with these mind-bending scientific facts!"

6.script: Scientific facts that will blow your mind. Honey never spoils - archaeologists have discovered pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still perfectly edible. The deadliest animals on Earth are actually mosquitoes, responsible for over 725,000 human deaths each year. Diamonds aren't forever - they can actually burn if exposed to high enough temperatures. Octopuses can edit their own DNA, making them masters of adaptation. And did you know that Saturn's density is so low that if there was a bathtub big enough to hold it, Saturn would float in the water? Dive into the fascinating world of science!

7.script: Scientific facts that will blow your mind. A two-second space trip could put you on Mars. The female kangaroo has three vaginas. Brazil nut allergies can be triggered by kissing. The human brain can hold quadrillions of connections. Lions can mate over 50 times in one day.

8.script: Scientific facts that will blow your mind. The average human body contains enough iron to make a 3-inch nail. Honey never spoils, archaeologists have found pots of honey in Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still perfectly edible. Sound travels 4 times faster in water than in air, so whales can communicate with each other over long distances. Birds actually have a built-in compass in their eyes that allows them to navigate and migrate accurately. Cockroaches can live without their head for weeks because they breathe through tiny holes in their body segments, not their mouth.
8.translated_script: वैज्ञानिक तथ्य जो आपको हक्का बक्का कर देंगे। सामान्य मानव शरीर में इस क़दर लोहा होता है की जिससे एक 3-इंच नाखून बनाया जा सकेगा। शहद कभी खराब नहीं होता, पुरातत्वविदों ने इजिप्शियन ख़जानों में मिले शहद के बर्तनों को देखा है जो 3,000 साल पुराने होने के बावजूद भी अच्छी तरह खाद्यत्मक अवस्था में हैं। ध्वनि पानी में हवा की अपेक्षा 4 गुना तेज़ी से यात्रा करती है, इसलिए तारास एक दूसरे के साथ लंबी दूरी पर संवाद कर सकते हैं। पक्षियों के आँखों में वास्तव में एक इंटीग्रेटेड कंपास होता है जो उन्हें सही रास्ता बताने और यात्रा करने में सहायता करता है। तिलचट्टे अपने सिर के बिना भी हफ्तों तक जीते रह सकते हैं क्योंकि वे अपने शरीर सेगमेंट में छोटे छेदों के माध्यम से साँस लेते हैं, न की मुंह से।

10.script: Scientific Facts you don't know. The world's smallest rainforest is in Buckinghamshire, England, covering 14.7 acres. Seahorses are monogamous creatures and stay with one partner for life. Trained rats can detect landmines and tuberculosis with amazing success rates. Every single hamster is left-handed. On average, humans share about 60% of their DNA with bananas. Researchers have found that cows with names produce more milk than those without names. And did you know that New Zealand is home to the world's smallest species of penguins? Keep watching for more fascinating scientific facts!

11.script: Scientific facts that will blow your mind. Astronauts grow up to 2 inches taller in space due to the absence of gravity. Honey never spoils. It has been found in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still perfectly edible. A bolt of lightning is six times hotter than the surface of the sun. The human brain can generate enough electricity to power a small lightbulb. The longest continuous walking path around the world spans over 22,000 miles. Get ready to be amazed by more scientific wonders on our channel!

13.script: Scientific facts that will amaze you. The average person will consume over 70,000 meals in their lifetime. This amounts to roughly 35 tons of food. - Atoms are mostly empty space. If the nucleus was the size of a marble, the electrons spinning around it would be 1 mile away. - Your brain uses about 20% of the body's total energy, even though it only makes up about 2% of the body's weight. - Human bones are stronger than steel. A matchbox-sized cube of bone can support a weight of 9 tons. - Our eyes are so sensitive, they can detect even a single photon of light. Fascinating, isn't it?

14.script: Scientific facts that will blow your mind. Did you know that there are more bacteria on your body than human cells? Venus is the only planet in our solar system that spins clockwise. The rest spin counterclockwise! The bristlecone pine is the oldest tree in the world, with some individual trees living over 5,000 years. If you could fold a piece of paper 42 times, it would reach the moon. The faint booming you hear during a lightning storm is actually the sound of thunder traveling along the ground.
14.translated_script: वैज्ञानिक तथ्य जो आपको आश्चर्यचकित कर देंगे। क्या आप जानते हैं कि आपके शरीर पर मानव कोशिकाओं से अधिक बैक्टीरिया होते हैं? वीनस हमारे सौरमंडल में एकमात्र ग्रह है जो घड़ी की दिशा में घूमता है। बाकी ग्रह वामावर्ती दिशा में घूमते हैं! ब्रिस्टलकोन पाइन विश्व का सबसे पुराना पेड़ है, कुछ वृक्ष 5,000 साल से अधिक जीवित रहते हैं। अगर आप 42 बार कागज़ को मोड़ सकें, तो यह चांद पर पहुंच जाएगा। बिजली के बाद आप सुनते हैं उसकी ध्वनि वास्तव में धरती की सतह पर यात्रा कर रही गरज की आवाज़ है।

15.script: Scientific facts that will blow your mind. Scientists have discovered a new species of snake that can glide through the air for up to 100 meters. Plants can communicate with each other through a complex network of underground fungi, sharing nutrients and warnings of danger. Neuroscientists have found that daydreaming is actually a sign of high intelligence and creativity. There is a species of octopus, known as the mimic octopus, that can change its shape, color, and behavior to mimic other creatures. Did you know that scientists have successfully teleported qubits - the fundamental building blocks of quantum information?
15.translated_script: वैज्ञानिक तथ्य जो आपके मन को चुनौती देंगे। वैज्ञानिकों ने एक नई सांप की प्रजाति खोजी है, जो आकाश में उड़कर लगभग १०० मीटर तक कम कर सकती है। पौधे एक जटिल भूतली फंगस के माध्यम से एक दूसरे के साथ संवाद कर सकते हैं, पोषण तत्वों का साझा कर सकते हैं और खतरे की चेतावनी दे सकते हैं। स्नायु-विज्ञानी ने खोजा है कि ख्वाबों के बारे में सोचना वास्तव में उच्च बुद्धिमत्ता और रचनात्मकता की निशानी है। एक प्रजाति के जैसा बदलता हुआ सुरंगमारी सप्ताह, रंग और व्यवहार कर सकती है, जिसे मिमिक ऑक्टोपस के नाम से जाना जाता है। क्या आप जानते हैं कि वैज्ञानिकों ने सफलतापूर्वक क्वांटम सूचना के आधारभूत निर्माण इकाइयों, जिन्हें क्यूबिट कहा जाता है, की टेलीपोर्टेशन किया है?

16.script: Scientific facts that will blow your mind. Did you know that ants never sleep? They can go for over two weeks without taking a nap. The human brain weighs about 3 pounds but uses 20% of the body's total energy. Elephants are the only mammal that can't jump. There are over 100,000 chemical reactions happening in your brain every second. When liquid nitrogen is poured on bananas, they become as hard as a rock.

17.script: Scientific facts that will amaze you. Elephants are afraid of bees and can actually communicate through vibrations in the ground. Researchers have found that plants can actually hear and react to certain sounds. Honey never spoils, archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still perfectly edible. Cancer patients' hair often grows back a different color and texture after chemotherapy. The human brain can store up to 2.5 petabytes of data, which is equivalent to three million hours of television shows.
timed_image_searches: honey in ancient Egyptian tombs image
different color hair after chemotherapy image

18.script: Scientific facts that will blow your mind. Honey never spoils. It was found perfectly preserved in ancient Egyptian tombs. Our brain generates enough electricity to power a small light bulb. People with blue eyes share a common ancestor from thousands of years ago. The atoms in our bodies are billions of years old and once belonged to stars. A spoonful of neutron star material would weigh as much as a mountain. Neanderthals used medicinal plants for pain relief and to treat illnesses. Plants can detect when they are being eaten and release chemicals to attract predators of their attackers. Scientists have created see-through wood by removing chemicals that make it opaque. Get ready to discover even more mind-blowing scientific facts!

20.script: Science facts that will blow your mind. Sea otters hold hands while they sleep to prevent drifting apart. There is a species of jellyfish that can revert back to its earliest form after reaching maturity and start its life cycle all over again. Lobsters have a built-in GPS system in their brain that allows them to navigate across long distances. Stars produce sounds, but they are in the form of electromagnetic vibrations that can only be detected with special equipment. The Eiffel Tower grows taller by up to 6 inches during hotter months due to the expansion of iron in the heat.

21.script: Scientific facts that will blow your mind. Human saliva contains a painkiller called opiorphin Most of the universe is filled with dark matter and dark energy, things we still barely understand Every day, your heart creates enough energy to drive a truck for 20 miles The human brain can store the equivalent of 2.5 million gigabytes There are over 4,000 different known species of frogs, each with their own unique features and behaviors.
timed_image_searches: universe filled with dark matter image

22.script: Jaw-dropping scientific facts you don't know. White holes, theorized but never observed, are the exit points of black holes. Time slows down the closer you get to the speed of light, making astronauts age slower than your average Earth dweller. Lightning can actually strike the same place twice, and sometimes even more. Did you know that the longest spider silk ever recorded was stronger than steel? And lastly, astronauts' footprints on the moon will remain there for at least 10 million years, thanks to the lack of wind and erosion. Get ready to have your mind blown by even more scientific marvels!
timed_image_searches: lack of wind and erosion image

23.script: Scientific facts that will blow your mind. Cockroaches can survive for weeks without their heads because they have open circulatory systems and can still breathe through small holes in their body. The Great Red Spot on Jupiter is a massive storm that has been raging for over 400 years. It's so large that it could fit three Earths inside. There are more bacterial cells in your body than human cells. In fact, you have over 100 trillion bacteria living inside you right now. Chickens can be taught to play simple games and even have basic problem-solving skills. They can learn to peck at shapes on a touchscreen in exchange for food rewards.

24.script: Scientific facts that will blow your mind. Honey never spoils. It has been found in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and is still perfectly edible. On Jupiter and Saturn, it rains diamonds. The extreme pressure and temperature on these gas giants cause carbon atoms to crystallize into diamonds, which then fall like rain. A new species of bacteria was discovered in the volcanic springs of Yellowstone National Park. They can survive without oxygen, light, and obtain energy solely from organic matter found in rocks. The world's smallest drone was developed by scientists. It weighs only 7.5 grams, is the size of a honeybee, and can fly autonomously for 5 minutes.
timed_image_searches: diamond rain on Jupiter and Saturn image
energy from organic matter in rocks image
smallest drone in the world image

25.script: Amazing Scientific Facts you never knew. A teaspoon of neutron star weighs as much as a mountain! Lightning strikes can create a "shocked quartz," a type of rock that literally gets shattered by an explosion of energy. Scientists discovered a new species of whale in the Gulf of Mexico in 2016, thanks to its distinct "song". The world's first "centıpclop" has been engineered by scientists who regrew the crushed portion of a woodstock roach's leg directly on its stump! Do you know that silent whales have dialects?! Whale pods located in distinct parts of the world have been found to have different "something-sir" patterns.

26.script: Scientific facts that will blow your mind. Did you know that a single strand of DNA can hold enough information to fill a library with books? The largest known living organism is not a blue whale or an elephant, but a fungus spanning an area of 2,385 acres in Oregon. The shortest war in history happened between Britain and Zanzibar, lasting only 38 minutes. Months that start on a Sunday will always have a Friday the 13th. Lightning can strike the same place more than once - the Empire State Building gets struck about 100 times a year! Fascinating, right?
26.yt_description: Discover mind-blowing scientific facts that will leave you amazed! From the incredible capacity of a single strand of DNA to the shocking truth about lightning strikes. Prepare to have your mind blown! #ScienceFacts #MindBlowingFacts #AmazingFacts

27.script: Get ready to dive into some fascinating historical facts you never knew. Did you know that Cleopatra was not actually Egyptian? She was actually of Greek heritage, descended from the very famous ruler Alexander the Great. Alexander's conquest of Egypt brought about the Ptolemaic dynasty, under which Cleopatra was the last queen. And here's another jaw-dropper: The Great Pyramid of Giza initially had a smooth limestone coating, making it shine like a giant jewel across the desert sands. Yes, that's right – it used to be covered in glimmering luxury. Stay tuned for more mind-blowing historical revelations!
27.translated_script: तैयार हो जाइए क्योंकि आपके पास एक रोचक ऐतिहासिक तथ्यों का गहराई से अभिव्यक्ति करने का मौका है जिनके बारे में आपने कभी नहीं जाना। क्या आप जानते हैं कि क्लियोपेट्रा वास्तव में मिस्री नहीं थीं? वास्तव में वह यूनानी वंशज थीं, और महान शासक अलेक्जेंडर दा ग्रेट के वंशजों का अंग्रेज़ी अनुसरण करती थीं। अलेक्जेंडर के मिस्र पर विजय ने प्तोलेमैयां राजवंश को जन्म दिया, जिसके अंतर्गत क्लियोपेट्रा अंतिम रानी थीं। और यहां एक और मुँह में छिप जाने वाली बात है: जीजा का महान पिरामिड पहले स्मूथ लाइमस्टोन कोटिंग के साथ था, जिससे वह मृदारविन्द्र के रेतीले मैदान के ऊपर एक महान ज्वेल की तरह चमकता था। हाँ, सही सुना है - यह पहले उज्ज्वल आभूषणों से ढंका होता था। और अब तक खुबसूरत ब्रह्मांडी ऐतिहासिक प्रकाशनों के लिए बने रहिए!

27.yt_title: 🔍 Mind-Blowing Historical Facts You Never Knew! 😱
27.yt_description: Discover fascinating historical facts that will astonish you! Did you know Cleopatra was Greek? And the Great Pyramid of Giza was covered in luxury? Get ready for more mind-blowing revelations! #HistoryFacts #Cleopatra #Pyramids #AncientEgypt

28.script: Mysterious Scientific Facts you need to know. Oxygen simultaneously supports and destroys life. In seconds, the wind can travel at 136 miles per hour, making it the fastest and proficient insect hunter. When astronauts are in space, they can grow up to two inches taller because there is no gravity squishing their spines. You can break glass by playing a note of a particular frequency called the resonant frequency. Strawberries can be whitened with viva paper towels dipped in Windex. Fantastic gravitational waves from two black holes colliding were heard and observed for the first time in 2015.

29.script: Scientific facts that will blow your mind. Sea stars can regenerate their entire body from just one arm. The universe is made up of a staggering 99.999999999% empty space. A day on Venus is longer than its year. Sweat itself is odorless, the smell that we associate with sweat comes from bacteria on our skin. And did you know that honey never spoils? Archaeologists found honey in Egyptian tombs that is over 3,000 years old and still perfectly edible.

30.script: Scientific facts that will blow your mind! Different whale species communicate with distinct dialects, like human languages. Our brains generate enough electricity to power a small light bulb. DNA evidence can now predict a suspect's outward appearance, like eye color and hair color. Over 99% of all the species that have ever lived on Earth are now extinct. Lightning can strike the same place twice, as witnessed by the Empire State Building in New York City.

31.script: Mind-boggling scientific facts that will blow your mind! Dolphins have names for each other and will use them when communicating. Bamboo can grow up to 35 inches in just 24 hours, making it the fastest growing plant on Earth. The left lung is smaller than the right lung to make space for the heart. Trees can communicate with each other through an underground network of fungi. The universe is expanding at a rate of 65 kilometers per second per megaparsec. Be amazed by the wonders of science!

32.script: Science Facts you don't know. Star-nosed moles have the ability to eat small prey in just 225 milliseconds. Venus is the only planet in our solar system that rotates clockwise. Oysters can change their gender multiple times throughout their lives. Bees can be trained to detect diseases such as cancer and tuberculosis. The average human body contains enough iron to make a metal nail 3 inches long. Shrimp's hearts are located in their heads.

33.script: Interesting scientific facts you don't know. Sound travels 4 times faster in water than in air. The average human body has enough iron to make a 3-inch nail. The collective weight of all the ants in the world is equal to the weight of all humans. Our eyes are always the same size from birth, but our nose and ears never stop growing. Every day, your body loses about 1 million skin cells, which adds up to about 2 kilograms of skin cells every year. Oxygen and fire do not mix peacefully in space, resulting in fireballs instead of flames.

34.script: Scientific Facts you don't know. Our bodies emit enough heat in 30 minutes to boil water. Spiders can regenerate their legs if they lose them. Albert Einstein's brain was stolen after his death and dissected, but its whereabouts remain unknown. Lightning can produce temperatures hotter than the surface of the sun. The human brain is more active at night than during the day.
timed_image_searches: active brain during the day image
